OST401.name: Selected Topics in Osteopathic Medicine
OST401.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
OST401.description: Classical, current and innovative osteopathic medical trends in patient treatment and care.

OST551.name: Osteopathic Patient Care I
OST551.description: Clinical assessment skills and evidence-based medicine to develop effective critical thinking in the doctor patient relationship.
OST551.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

OST552.name: Osteopathic Patient Care II
OST552.description: Clinical assessment skills and evidence-based medicine to develop effective critical thinking in the care of patients, as it relates to neurology, orthopedics, physiatry, endocrine, female reproduction and genitourinary systems.
OST552.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

OST553.name: Osteopathic Patient Care III
OST553.description: Integration of components of the doctor patient relationship, clinical assessment skills and evidence based medicine to develop effective critical thinking and assessment skills in the care of patients. Correlations to concurrent integumentary and gastrointestinal systems courses. Preparation for future role as physician educator.
OST553.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

OST554.name: Osteopathic Patient Care IV
OST554.description: Integration of components of the doctor patient relationship, clinical assessment skills and evidence based medicine to develop effective critical thinking and assessment skills in the care of patients. Correlations to concurrent psychopathology, hematopoietic, and cardiovascular systems courses.
OST554.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

OST555.name: Osteopathic Patient Care V
OST555.description: Integration of components of the doctor patient relationship, clinical assessment skills and evidence based medicine in the care of patients. Correlation to concurrent respiratory system course. Presentation skills.
OST555.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

OST556.name: Pediatrics I
OST556.description: Normal growth and development of children from birth to 18 years. Conditions of the nervous, musculoskeletal, endocrine and genitourinary systems that affect children.
OST556.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

OST557.name: Pediatrics II
OST557.description: Normal structure, function and pathologies of the integumentary, reproductive, and gastrointestinal systems as they relate to children.
OST557.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

OST558.name: Pediatrics III
OST558.description: Normal structure, function and pathologies of the behavioral, cardiovascular, hematopoietic and respiratory systems as they relate to the pediatric population. Ethical considerations in pediatrics.
OST558.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

OST566.name: Care for the Young and the Aging Adult I
OST566.description: Focus on children birth to 18 years, and the elderly greater than 65. Normal growth, development, and aging.
OST566.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

OST567.name: Care for the Young and the Aging Adult II
OST567.description: Focus on children birth to 18 and elderly greater than 65. Normal structure, function and pathologies focusing on the nervous, endocrine, reproductive and genitourinary systems.
OST567.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

OST568.name: Care for the Young and the Aging Adult III
OST568.description: Focus on children birth to 18 and elderly greater than 65. Normal structure, function and pathologies focusing on the integumentary and gastrointestinal systems.
OST568.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

OST569.name: Care for the Young and the Aging Adult IV
OST569.description: Focus on children birth to 18 and elderly greater than 65. Normal structure, function and pathologies focusing on behavioral, cardiovascular and hematopoietic systems.
OST569.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

OST570.name: Care for the Young and the Aging Adult V
OST570.description: Focus on children birth to 18 and elderly greater than 65. Normal structure, function and pathologies focusing on the respiratory system.
OST570.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

OST571.name: Neuromusculoskeletal System
OST571.description: Systems Neuromusculoskeletal Medicine from basic science through clinical neurology, orthopedics, rheumatology, physiatry and ophthalmology. Neuroanatomy, orthopedic anatomy, integration with clinical neurology, orthopedics, physiatry and ophthalmology.
OST571.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

OST572.name: Genitourinary System
OST572.description: Normal urinary and male reproductive structure and function; principles of diagnosis and management of urinary and male reproductive disorders. Integration of basic science and clinical information related to the urinary and male reproductive systems.
OST572.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

OST573.name: Endocrine System
OST573.description: Multidisciplinary approach to endocrinology. Normal endocrine structure and function; principles of diagnosis and management of endocrine disorders. Integration of basic science and clinical information.
OST573.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

OST574.name: Female Reproductive System
OST574.description: Normal structure and function of related pathologies with the female reproductive system. Integration of basic science and clinical information in obstetrics and gynecology.
OST574.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

OST575.name: Gastrointestinal System
OST575.description: Systems biology approach to the entire digestive track, including accessory organs of digestion. Normal structure and function and pathologies. Integration of basic science and clinical information.
OST575.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

OST576.name: Integumentary System
OST576.description: Systems biology approach to the integumentary system, to include the skin and its epidermal derivatives. Normal structure and function and pathologies. Integration of basic science and clinical information.
OST576.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

OST577.name: Psychopathology
OST577.description: Systems biology approach to the behavioral system. Normal structure and function and pathologies of the mind to include integration of basic science and clinical information.
OST577.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

OST578.name: Hematopoietic System
OST578.description: Systems biology approach to the hematopoietic system including normal structure and function, hematopoiesis, clotting and hematopoietic pathologies. Integration of basic science and clinical information.
OST578.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

OST579.name: Cardiovascular System
OST579.description: Systems biology approach to the cardiovascular system, including the heart and vasculature throughout the body. Normal structure and function and pathologies. Integration of basic science and clinical information.
OST579.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

OST580.name: Respiratory System
OST580.description: Systems biology approach to the entire respiratory system.
OST580.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

OST581.name: Ethics, Professionalism and Law
OST581.description: Introduction to the legal principles and ethical standards relevant to the practice of medicine including a variety of applicable legal theories such as negligence, liability and fraud. Topics of professional responsibility, confidentiality, consent, end-of-life issues, and reproductive rights are also included.
OST581.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

OST582.name: Transitions I: Board Preparation
OST582.description: Selected topics in preparation for licensure board exams.
OST582.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

OST583.name: Geriatrics
OST583.description: Normal aging, structure, function and pathologies of older persons greater than 65.
OST583.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

OST590.name: Special Problems
OST590.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
OST590.description: Individual study directed by a faculty member on an experimental, theoretical, or applied problem.
OST590.restrictions: Open only to graduate-professional students in College of Osteopathic Medicine. Approval of college.

OST591.name: Medical Case Study Journal Review
OST591.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
OST591.description: Analysis and presentation of published clinical case reports in the context of basic science principles and biomedical concepts.
OST591.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

OST592.name: Self-Directed Integration of Medical Knowledge
OST592.description: Self-directed review and integration of basic science and systems medical knowledge content and clinical correlations using coaching and workshops.
OST592.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

OST593.name: Scholarly Activity Seminar
OST593.semester: Fall of every year, Summer of every year
OST593.description: Survey of scholarly activity in medicine.
OST593.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

OST597.name: Biomedical Research Structure and Methods
OST597.description: Intensive review of biomedical research methods and statistical analyses for mentored clinical research projects.

OST598.name: Evidence-Based Health Science
OST598.description: Evidence-based approach to osteopathic basic science and clinical education and application to health science, critical review of literature, and research design.
OST598.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

OST599.name: Biomedical Research
OST599.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
OST599.description: Basic, applied, or translational medical research under the direction of a mentor. Research topic is arranged with the research director or clinician researcher.
OST599.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine. Approval of college.

OST601.name: Transitions II: Classroom to Bedside
OST601.description: Selected topics designed to assist the COM student in transitioning from the classroom to the clinical learning environment.
OST601.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

OST602.name: Primary Care Ambulatory Clerkship
OST602.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
OST602.description: A 24-week ambulatory care continuity experience involving 12 weeks in a multidisciplinary environment (family medicine, pediatrics, and internal medicine), 4 weeks in family medicine and 8 weeks in specialty areas (internal medicine, surgery, pediatrics, and obstetrics and gynecology). Didactic sessions are scheduled concurrently.

OST603.name: Core Clinical Concepts
OST603.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
OST603.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

OST604.name: Essential Clinical Skills for the Senior Medical Student
OST604.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
OST604.description: Longitudinal experience addressing essential skills for senior osteopathic medical students.
OST604.restrictions: Open to seniors in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

OST609.name: Laboratory Medicine Clerkship
OST609.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
OST609.description: Laboratory procedures. Correlation of laboratory data with morphologic abnormalities in patients with pathophysiology.
OST609.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine or in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

OST610.name: Pathology Clerkship
OST610.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
OST610.description: Anatomic and clinical pathology with emphasis on clinical-pathological correlation. Conducted in pathology departments of affiliated hospitals.
OST610.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine or in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

OST615.name: Biomedical Research Clerkship
OST615.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
OST615.description: Mentored exposure to either basic or clinical research and development of skills to perform clinical or basic science research. Research topic is arranged with the research director or clinician researcher.
OST615.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine. Approval of college.

OST685.name: International Clerkship Rotations
OST685.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
OST685.description: Faculty supervised international clerkship opportunities to immerse students into global healthcare institutions and communities with various healthcare delivery systems that will include student introduction to common diseases and treatment, and cultural sensitivity outside of the required clerkship experience in our affiliated hospital system.

OST686.name: Global Health: Mexico - Clinical Immersion
OST686.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
OST686.description: Observation of and supervised participation in host country’s healthcare delivery system. Etiology, treatment, and control of endemic disease. Exploration of local culture and history.
OST686.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine or approval of college.

OST687.name: Global Health: Peru - Clinical Immersion
OST687.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
OST687.description: Observation of and supervised participation in host country’s healthcare delivery system. Etiology, treatment, and control of endemic disease. Exploration of local culture and history. Offered second half of semester.
OST687.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine or approval of college.

OST688.name: Global Health: Cuba - Clinical Immersion
OST688.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
OST688.description: Observation of and supervised participation in host country’s healthcare delivery system. Etiology, treatment, and control of endemic disease. Exploration of local culture and history.
OST688.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine or approval of college.

OST689.name: Global Health: Haiti - Clinical Immersion
OST689.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
OST689.description: Observation of and supervised participation in host country’s healthcare delivery system. Etiology, treatment, and control of endemic disease. Exploration of local culture and history.
OST689.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine or in the College of Osteopathic Medicine or in the College of Nursing or approval of college.

OST690.name: Global Health: Dominican Republic - Clinical Immersion
OST690.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
OST690.description: Observation of and supervised participation in host country’s healthcare delivery system. Etiology, treatment, and control of endemic disease. Exploration of local culture and history.
OST690.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine or approval of college.

OST691.name: Global Health: Guatemala - Clinical Immersion
OST691.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
OST691.description: Observation of and supervised participation in host country’s healthcare delivery system. Etiology, treatment, and control of endemic disease. Tropical disease. Exploration of local culture and history.
OST691.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine or approval of college.

OST692.name: Global Health: Turkey - Clinical Immersion
OST692.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
OST692.description: Observation of and supervised participation in host country’s healthcare delivery system. Etiology, treatment, and control of endemic disease. Exploration of local culture and history.
OST692.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine or approval of college.

OST693.name: Global Health: South Korea - Clinical Immersion
OST693.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
OST693.description: Observation of and supervised participation in host country’s healthcare delivery system. Etiology, treatment, and control of endemic disease. Exploration of local culture and history.
OST693.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine or approval of college.

OST694.name: Global Health: Nepal - Clinical Immersion
OST694.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
OST694.description: Observation of and supervised participation in host country’s healthcare delivery system. Etiology, treatment, and control of endemic disease. One Health. Exploration of local culture and history.
OST694.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine or approval of college.

OST802.name: Operations Analysis and Decision-Making in the Health Professions
OST802.description: Concepts of operations analysis, strategic and operational decision making in health care management and regulation, quality assurance and improvement, and quality outcomes research assessment.

OST804.name: Public Health Policy and the Law in the Health Professions
OST804.description: Theory and processes of public health policy and its impact on health providers with consideration of the integral relationship between health providers in the public and private sectors, health policy agencies and legislative and ethical decision making processes.

OST820.name: Capstone Course for the Health Professions
OST820.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
OST820.description: Demonstration of the mastery of cognitive skills by application of appropriate information to a robust health-care management problem.
OST820.prerequisite: ED 820 and EAD 861 and EAD 866 and EAD 877 and OST 801 and OST 802 and OST 803 and (OST 804 or concurrently) and EAD 840 and EAD 863

OST821.name: One Health—Transdisciplinary Collaborations to Global Health
OST821.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
OST821.description: Transdisciplinary collaboration amongst different animal health, human health, and non-health specialists to solve problems at the interface of people, animals, and their environment.
OST821.restrictions: Open to master's students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine or approval of college.

OST822.name: Introduction to Global Health Practice
OST822.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
OST822.description: Differences in national models of healthcare delivery, issues of social justice and human rights principles, and strategies to engage marginalized and vulnerable populations.
OST822.restrictions: Open to master's students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine or approval of college.

OST823.name: Global Burden of Disease
OST823.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
OST823.description: Major causes of, types of, and efforts to reduce morbidity and mortality around the world. Techniques for monitoring and validating the health status of populations.
OST823.restrictions: Open to master's students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine or approval of college.

OST824.name: Emerging Topics in Global Health
OST824.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
OST824.description: Emerging topics in global health and connections to current issues.
OST824.restrictions: Open to master's students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine or approval of college.

OST825.name: Ethical Issues in Global Health
OST825.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
OST825.description: International standards for protection of human subjects. Social justice and human rights principles within the global context.
OST825.restrictions: Open to master's students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine or approval of college.

OST827.name: Global Health Management
OST827.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
OST827.description: Leadership and management within the context of global healthcare, including interprofessional and intercultural values and communication.
OST827.restrictions: Open to master's students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine or approval of college.

OST829.name: Global Health Community Assessment
OST829.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
OST829.description: Assessment of community health scenarios. Techniques for collaboration and co-creation with community partners.
OST829.restrictions: Open to master's students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine or approval of college.

OST830.name: Independent Study in Global Health
OST830.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
OST830.description: Independent study in areas relevant to global health.
OST830.restrictions: Open to master's students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine or approval of college.

OST831.name: Evidence-Based Practice in Global Health
OST831.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
OST831.description: Critical appraisal of scientific studies of global health interventions.
OST831.restrictions: Open to master's students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine or approval of college.

OST832.name: Independent Study in United States Health Systems
OST832.description: Independent study in areas relevant to the United States Health Systems.

OST890.name: Independent Study
OST890.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
OST890.description: Supervised individual study in an area of osteopathic medicine.

OST894.name: Field Study
OST894.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
OST894.description: Supervised graduate practica and internships in Health Professions Education.
